result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Kontny was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cts 1&2: Court costs paid in full from bond posted. Pay supervision fees.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
No contact with co-defendant Nicholas Lamon

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

state
Further proceedings on June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Kontny in court with attorney Valdez.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing form filed. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Counsel will file bail motion which may be set to be heard with custodies the month of May.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody, in person and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises not sure if defendant qualifies for public defender representation at this time.  Counsel waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $5000 cash bail w/conditions.   State advises defendant has an active warrant with Greenfield Police on a PR Bond.  Court orders $5000 cash bail w/condition:  no contact with Nickolas Lamon; no contact with Target Store in Grafton.  Counsel requesting preliminary hearing and will not waive timelimits.  Court examines defendant on retaining counsel.  Court orders matter adj to 5/13 at 11 am for preliminary hearing.
